dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Mag 7 Earnings & DeepSeek: What Should Investors Know?
News Content: DeekSeek appears to have put a big dent in what everyone believed was a source of competitive advantage in the AI race for Tech leaders like Microsoft MSFT, Alphabet GOOGL, Amazon AMZN, and others. And if we go by how Microsoft and Meta described the evolving AI competitive landscape on their respective Q4 earnings calls last week, we will most likely hear comparable commentary from Amazon and Alphabet as they come out with their December-quarter results this week.

Market participants have all along been skeptical of the investment case for the extraordinarily heavy spending by Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, and others on AI-centric data centers and related infrastructure. The issue all along has been these companies’ inability to articulate a clear case for how these investments will get monetized.

While a lot about DeepSeek’s actual cost in building and training its model is unknown, notwithstanding the announced figure of a few million dollars, the hundreds of billions of dollars that these companies are collectively pouring into the project appears to be overkill. Microsoft and Meta reiterated their spending plans and see the resulting data center capacity as giving them a strategic advantage in the long run. We can safely assume that Amazon and Alphabet will follow Microsoft and Meta on this crucial question.

While the market’s collective focus was mainly on the AI question for Microsoft and Meta, the former disappointed in its core results, with cloud guidance coming up short, while the latter showed plenty of operating momentum in operating results. Microsoft’s December-quarter earnings were up +10.2% from the same period last year on +12.3% higher revenues, while Meta’s earnings and revenues increased +48.7% and +20.6% from the year-earlier levels, respectively.

Apple and Tesla, the other Mag 7 players that also reported results last week, received favorable market reception. However, the positive market follow-through was likely less of a response to the core results and more of a sigh of relief at better-than-feared numbers.

China has emerged as a major risk in the Apple story, with tepid iPhone demand in that key market and the company’s continuing AI struggles taking center stage. Some anecdotal evidence suggests that some of Apple’s local Chinese competitors are giving it a lot tougher competition than in years past. On top of that is the prospect of tariffs, a far bigger issue for Apple than the rest of its Mag 7 peers.

Apple’s December-quarter earnings were up +7.1% on +4% higher revenues, while Tesla’s earnings and revenues for the period were up +15.7% and +2.1% from the year-earlier level, respectively. Net margins were up at Apple and Tesla, with Apple’s margins up 86 basis points from the same period last year while Tesla’s expanded 105 bps.

繼續閱讀

Take a look at the chart below that shows current consensus expectations for the ‘Mag 7’ stocks as a whole for the current and coming periods in the context of what they were able to achieve in the preceding period. The +25.6% earnings growth comprises actual results from the four group members that have reported and estimates for Alphabet, Amazon, and Nvidia (that haven’t reported yet).Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The chart below that shows the group’s earnings and revenue growth on an annual basis.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Beyond these Mag 7 players, total Q4 earnings for the Technology sector as a whole are expected to be up +19.2% from the same period last year on +10.8% higher revenues.

The chart below shows the sector’s Q4 earnings and revenue growth expectations in the context of where growth has been in recent quarters and what is expected in the coming three periods.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The chart below shows the sector’s growth picture on an annual basis.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The Tech sector has enjoyed a favorable revisions trend for the last few quarters, with the Mag 7 stocks in the fore front of the rising estimates trend. The +16.9% earnings growth expected for the sector for 2025 at present is up from the +15.8% growth expected three months back.

Q4 Earnings Season Scorecard

Through Friday, January 31st, we have seen Q4 results from 179 S&P 500 members, or 35.8% of the index’s total membership. Total earnings for these companies are up +7.4% from the same period last year on +5.1% higher revenues, with 80.4% beating EPS estimates and 67% beating revenue estimates.

The comparison charts below put the Q4 earnings and revenue growth rates relative to other recent periods for the same group of index members.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The comparison charts below put the Q4 EPS and revenue beats percentages relative to other recent periods for the same group of companies.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Key Earnings Reports This Week

The 132 S&P 500 members on deck to report results this week include several blue-chip operators like Pfizer, Pepsi, Ford, and others, in addition to the aforementioned Mag 7 players (Amazon and Alphabet).

By the end of this week, we will have seen Q4 results from more than 63% of the index’s total membership.

The Earnings Big Picture

The chart below shows the Q4 earnings and revenue growth expectations in the context of where growth has been in the preceding four quarters and what is expected in the coming four quarters.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Excluding the contribution from the Mag 7 companies, S&P 500 earnings would have been up +5.6% on +4.1% higher revenues.

The chart below shows the overall earnings picture on a calendar-year basis, with double-digit earnings growth expected in 2025 and 2026.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Please note that the very strong growth expected in 2025 is not driven by one or two sectors but is rather broad-based. All 16 Zacks sectors are expected to enjoy positive earnings growth in 2025, with 8 of the 16 Zacks sectors expected to achieve double-digit earnings growth.

For a detailed look at the overall earnings picture, including expectations for the coming periods, please check out our weekly Earnings Trends report >>>> Broad Based Sector Growth Expected for 2025

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The financial news highlights mixed sentiments regarding the performance of Apple and other tech giants in the face of heavy investments in AI. While Apple reported a modest earnings increase of +7.1%, concerns about weak iPhone demand in China and increased competition present potential headwinds. Despite favorable market reactions to earnings reports, the prevailing skepticism about substantial investments in AI and competition risks may weigh on investor sentiment, leading to a cautious outlook for AAPL. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a balanced view of the potential for both rises and falls in stock price.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple (AAPL). It acknowledges Apple's better-than-feared earnings, but also highlights China as a major risk due to slowing iPhone demand and increased competition from local Chinese companies. The potential for tariffs is also a significant concern for Apple. While the overall tech sector and Mag 7 earnings show positive growth, the specific challenges faced by Apple in China, its AI struggles, and tariff risks outweigh the general positive trends. This suggests a higher likelihood of a price decrease in accordance with negative press.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Apple's Q4 earnings beat expectations, the report highlights concerns about weakening iPhone demand in China and intensifying competition.  The positive market reaction to Apple's results was attributed more to relief over better-than-feared numbers, rather than strong underlying performance.  The article also emphasizes the uncertainty around the AI investments of other tech giants, which indirectly suggests Apple's own AI struggles are a significant headwind.  The overall positive sentiment regarding the tech sector is somewhat tempered by the China risk specific to Apple. Based on this, the probability of a price rise is lower than the probability of a price fall, although the fall isn't predicted to be drastic.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights concerns about Apple's competitive position in China, tepid iPhone demand, and AI struggles, which could negatively impact investor sentiment. However, Apple's December-quarter earnings and revenues showed growth, albeit modest, and net margins improved. The mixed signals suggest uncertainty, but the emphasis on challenges in China and AI may weigh more heavily on investor perceptions.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The provided news discusses the earnings of major tech companies, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), and their performance in the AI race. While Apple's earnings report was described as better-than-feared, concerns about iPhone demand in China and AI struggles are noted. However, the overall sentiment seems to be more positive for Apple compared to some of its peers, with net margins increasing. Given that the news does not introduce significant negative surprises specific to Apple and considering the general positive market reception for Apple's results, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the recent earnings reports of the 'Mag 7' companies, including Apple, and the impact of DeepSeek on the AI competitive landscape. While Apple's December-quarter earnings were up 7.1% on 4% higher revenues, the company faces challenges in China, including tepid iPhone demand and AI struggles. The article also mentions that the market's focus was on the AI question for Microsoft and Meta, and that Apple and Tesla received favorable market reception despite some disappointments in their core results. Overall, the article presents a mixed picture for Apple's stock price movement.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news highlights mixed signals for Apple Inc. (AAPL). While Apple's earnings increased by 7.1% with revenues up 4%, there are concerns regarding tepid iPhone demand in China and potential competition from local competitors. Additionally, the uncertainty around AI development and the ongoing tariff issues add to the complexity. However, the favorable market reception following previous earnings and the stable performance compared to peers suggest a somewhat cautious optimism.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). The company reported a modest earnings increase of 7.1% with a 4% rise in revenues, which is a positive sign. However, there are significant concerns about weak iPhone demand in China, increased competition from local players, and ongoing risks related to AI investments and potential tariffs. While there was a favorable market reaction to better-than-expected earnings, the prevailing issues overshadow this optimism. Given the competitive landscape and economic pressures, the probabilities reflect a cautious outlook for AAPL with a slight bias toward a price decline.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.43, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.57, Reasoning: The previous round of predictions presents a mixed sentiment regarding Apple, with probabilities hovering around 50/50 for both rise and fall. Concerns regarding China and AI are balanced against decent earnings and positive market reception. The current news lacks any significantly new information that would drastically shift this balance. The fact that other models have not converged on a strong directional bias, even after a first round of analysis, reinforces the perception of uncertainty. Given this, I will slightly adjust the probabilities, leaning slightly towards a price fall due to existing concerns, but acknowledging that the company isn't facing any immediate crisis. Also note that lower range of predictions (0.35) exists in previous round which indicates a considerable down side for the stock price.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the company beat earnings expectations and showed improved margins, significant headwinds exist.  Concerns about weakening iPhone demand in China, intensified competition in that key market, and ongoing struggles in the AI sector are substantial risks.  The positive market reaction to the earnings report seems to be more a relief reaction than an indication of strong underlying momentum.  While the broader tech sector shows positive growth, Apple's specific challenges, particularly in China and AI, outweigh the general positive trends. The previous predictions show a wide range of probabilities, mostly reflecting the mixed signals. Considering these factors, and the lack of any overwhelmingly positive news, the probability of a price rise is considered slightly lower than the probability of a fall.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The financial news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). Positive aspects include modest earnings growth (+7.1%) and improved net margins, alongside a generally favorable market reception to recent earnings. However, significant concerns arise from tepid iPhone demand in China, increased competition from local Chinese companies, and ongoing struggles in AI development. Additionally, potential tariffs pose a further risk. While the broader tech sector shows positive growth, Apple-specific challenges are notable. Given these mixed signals and the emphasis on China-related risks, the balance tilts slightly towards a negative short-term impact on the stock price.

While the company reported modest earnings growth of +7.1% and +4% higher revenues, concerns about weak iPhone demand in China, increased competition from local Chinese companies, and AI struggles are significant headwinds. However, Apple's net margins improved, and the overall tech sector shows positive growth trends. Considering these factors, the probabilities reflect a cautious outlook with a slightly higher likelihood of the stock price falling than rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed picture for Apple's stock price movement. Additionally, ongoing struggles in AI investment and potential tariffs further complicate the situation. Other models indicate a general trend of cautious sentiment leaning towards potential declines in stock price due to these challenges, despite the relatively favorable market reception of Apple's earnings. Taking these factors into account, I estimate a higher probability for a price decline over a rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The persistent concerns about Apple's performance in China, especially the tepid iPhone demand and increasing local competition, weigh heavily on the stock's outlook. While Apple's earnings weren't disastrous and margins improved, the general sense is that the results were more of a relief than indicative of robust growth.
